item.title: Vicki Renee add a quote by Paul Auster
item.description: "Dismantling the architecture of my discontent" -- Paul Auster

item.title: Vicki Renee add a quote by Paul Auster
item.description: "it's a rare day when she speaks in anything but platitudes--all those exhausted phrases and hand-me-down ideas that cram the dump sites of contemporary wisdom" -- Paul Auster

item.title: Vicki Renee add a quote by Robert Girardi
item.description: "His brain and his heart knew this, but he couldn’t stop himself, and the razor of his conscience lent the undeniable thrill of pain to the act." -- Robert Girardi

item.title: Vicki Renee add a quote by Gabriel Garcia Marquez
item.description: "She would not shed a tear, she would not waste the rest of her years simmering in the maggot broth of memory." -- Gabriel Garcia Marquez

item.title: Vicki Renee add a quote by Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez
item.description: "he dared to explore her withered neck w/his fingertips…her hips w/their decaying bones, her thighs with their aging veins." -- Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez

item.title: Vicki Renee add a quote by Gabriel Garcia Marquez
item.description: "I’ve remained a virgin for you." -- Gabriel Garcia Marquez

item.title: Vicki Renee add a quote by Gabriel Garcia Marquez
item.description: "The world is divided into those who screw and those who do not. He distrusted those who did not—when they strayed from the straight and narrow it was something so unusual for them that they bragged about love as if they had just invented it." -- Gabriel Garcia Marquez

item.title: Vicki Renee add a quote by Gabriel Garcia Marquez
item.description: "He thought that the world would make more rapid progress without the burden of old people." -- Gabriel Garcia Marquez

item.title: Vicki Renee add a quote by Gabriel Garcia Marquez
item.description: "She felt the abyss of disenchantment." -- Gabriel Garcia Marquez

item.title: Vicki Renee add a quote by Gabriel Garcia Marquez
item.description: "He did not dare to console her, knowing that it would have been like consoling a tiger run thru by a spear." -- Gabriel Garcia Marquez

item.title: Vicki Renee add a quote by Mark Haddon
item.description: "She idly stroked his head in the way one might stroke a dog." -- Mark Haddon

item.title: Vicki Renee add a quote by Mark Haddon
item.description: "He really did not care whether he survived or not, so long as it rendered him unconscious and absolved him of responsibility." -- Mark Haddon

item.title: Vicki Renee add a quote by Mark Haddon
item.description: "He’d tried celibacy. The only problem was the lack of sex." -- Mark Haddon
